--- Mike Clark <mike@...> wrote:
> Jason Rogers wrote:
> 
> > --- sramaswa007@... wrote:
> > > Hi Jason,
> > >
> > >    Thanks for the reply. Yes looks like I need to have a servlet that
> > > can reload every 5 sec.  Assuming that I have such a servlet, what do
> > > I need to do to capture the results at some instance.  Right now I am
> > > using TestResult class to store the results and then passing them as
> > > response to the browser after all the test cases are run.  But in
> > > this case do I need to use TestListener interface and then use the
> > > addListener method of TestResult class.  Please let me know.
> >
> > That's a viable solution, probably not the only one though.
> >
> 
> Have you tried JUnitServlet?
> 
>     http://c2.com/cgi-bin/wiki?JunitServlet
> 
> It claims that the HTML result page updates itself when the tests are
> finished.  I haven't tried it myself, but it looks like another possible
> solution.

I think his hope is to have a TestRunner that updates a web page with its
results in real time, then he will have a servlet (or something else) that will
poll the server every N seconds to simulate a realtime environment.  If that is
the case, I don't think JUnitServlet is a solution because it's a framework for
testing servelts.  Or am I wrong about its purpose?
